intro: Lippia triplinervis, commonly known as the three-veined lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, featuring opposite leaves with a distinct three-veined structure. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it is also valued for its ornamental appeal. Lippia triplinervis thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
